title.narrative: Stöd till Svenska Kriminalvården för förstudie i Somalia
Support to Swedish Prison and Probation Service for pre-study in Somalia

description.narrative:
Kriminalvården (Krv) har inkommit med en förfrågan gällande 282 000 kronor för att finansiera en förstudie med syfte att utveckla ett bilateralt projekt i Somalia. Studien skulle äga rum mellan april - augusti 2019. Den totala budgeten för förstudien är 362 000 kronor. Krv planerar att finansiera de resterande 80 000 kronor.
Krv har varit verksamma inom svenskt utvecklingssamarbete sedan 90-talet och har idag personal i FN-missionerna i DRC, Liberia, CAR, Mali och Somalia. Två bilaterala projekt pågår även i Kenya och Albanien. Krv har även sedan 2015 via UNODC stationerat personal i Somaliland och har tack vare detta redan en väletablerad relation med Somalilands motsvarande myndighet "Somaliland Correctional Service".
Utöver en resa till Somaliland omfattar huvudaktiviteterna utvecklandet av en ToR, diskussioner med nyckelpersoner och att möjliggöra för feedback från relevanta intressenter på projektförslagets första utkast. En slutligt ansökan kommer att skickas till Sida vid slutet av aktivitetsperioden.

The Swedish Prison and Probation Service (SPPS) has requested a support of 282 000 SEK to fund a pre-study to develop a project proposal for a bilateral project in Somalia. The study would take place between April – August 2019. The total budget for the pre-study is 362 000 SEK. SPPS is planning to fund the remaining 80 000 SEK.
The SPPS has been active in Swedish development cooperation supporting correction systems in several countries since the 1990s. Currently, SPPS has personnel in DRC, Liberia, CAR, Mali and Somalia through the respective UN missions. Ongoing bilateral programmes are taking place in Kenya and Albania. SPPS officers have been stationed in Somaliland since 2015 working for UNODC and have established a good relationships with the Somaliland Correctional Service.
In addition to the fact-finding mission to Somalia, main activities include developing a ToR, communicating with key experts and allow feedback from stakeholders on draft proposal. A finalized proposal will be submitted to Sida by the end of the activity period.

The feasibility study aims to identify needs, ongoing activities, stakeholders and potential partners for a project proposal focused on women prisoners' needs and institutional capacity building involving non-state actors in Somaliland. Possible and suitable capacity development methods will be discussed during the study, which will then be an essential component of the future project. SPPS will also assess the space for action and write the project proposal during the activity period.

tag.narrative: 16.10 - 0 Säkerställa allmän tillgång till information och skydda grundläggande friheter, i enlighet med nationell lagstiftning och internationella avtal.
16.10 - Ensure public access to information and protect fundamental freedoms, in accordance with national legislation and international agreements.
16.3 - Främja rättssäkerheten på nationell och internationell nivå samt säkerställa lika tillgång till rättvisa för alla.
16.3 - Promote the rule of law at the national and international levels and ensure equal access to justice for all.
5.1 - Avskaffa alla former av diskriminering av alla kvinnor och flickor överallt
5.1 - End all forms of discrimination against all women and girls everywhere.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: No reports have been handed in but a request for a brief update on the progress of the project has been sent over email but not yet received. Hence, the only update on the results of the project so far is from the meeting between the Embassy and SPPS shortly after the research study had been concluded. SPPS communicated that the trip had been a success, much due to the assistance of the Somaliland Diplomatic Mission to Sweden which had accompanied them during parts of the trip. The only worry expressed was that there seemed to be some opposition among one key actor to having a non-Somali actor working in the prison and probation sector.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
